intro: Pycnandra paniensis, commonly known as the Panamá pycnandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
